intro: Ficus deltoidea var. oligoneura, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fig, is a species of flowering plant in the Moraceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. It produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible fig fruits. This species is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
